paragraphs.title: Read in CSV from AWS
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark%pyspark
from pyspark import SparkFiles
url = "https://s3.amazonaws.com/amazon-reviews-pds/tsv/amazon_reviews_us_Toys_v1_00.tsv.gz"
spark.sparkContext.addFile(url)
Toys_df = spark.read.csv(SparkFiles.get("amazon_reviews_us_Toys_v1_00.tsv.gz"), sep="\t", header=True)
Toys_df.show()

paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
url = "https://s3.amazonaws.com/amazon-reviews-pds/tsv/amazon_reviews_us_Video_Games_v1_00.tsv.gz"
spark.sparkContext.addFile(url)
video_games_df = spark.read.csv(SparkFiles.get("amazon_reviews_us_Video_Games_v1_00.tsv.gz"), sep="\t", header=True)
video_games_df.show()

paragraphs.title: # Clean up DataFrames to match tables
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
from pyspark.sql.functions import to_date
# Review DataFrame
review_id_df = df_concat.select(["review_id", "customer_id", "product_id", "product_parent", to_date("review_date", 'yyyy-MM-dd').alias("review_date")]).drop_duplicates()
review_id_df.show()

paragraphs.title: # Push to AWS RDS instance.
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
# Configuration for RDS instance
mode="append"
jdbc_url="jdbc:postgresql://mypostgresdb.cr2hoksxzp5a.us-east-2.rds.amazonaws.com:5432/big_data_db"
config = {"user":"root", 
          "password": "Jebn05041992", 
          "driver":"org.postgresql.Driver"}
